sub_title: Founder, Strategic Connector & social architect at The Hague Center for Global Governance, Innovation and Emergence
summary:
Anne-Marie is a spiritual business strategist, designer and mentor working with visionaries, leaders, teams, youngsters, unfolding potential to transform the dominant paradigm from fear to love and manifest a world that truly works for all.

She initiates and participates as project leader in ‘meshworking’ - multi stakeholder process design, delivery & development, including training. The nature of a meshwork is to commit to a meaningful and ambitious goal, to find the people and resources and develop the structures to achieve that goal. She is a certified trainer in various community development tools and numerous facilitation processes.

Anne-Marie encourages people of all ages to make use of their full potential and own creative power to (re)design their work into a meaningful and empowering part of their life. She is working internationally with businesses, business networks, international organizations, technology providers, groups of politicians, NGOs in diverse multi-stakeholder groups. Where appropriate, she plays a mentoring role, building the competence of team members and participants to own and take forward the process.  Her training combined with her international life experience has given her the ability to find rapport, and connect across cultures with different organizations, interest groups, political groupings, and professional societies. She dedicates a great deal of her time to build the network of networks that manifest the new paradigm.

awards.title: Meshworker of the Year 2019 Award
awards.description:
A Meshworker of the Year demonstrates the meshworking intelligence as defined on the website .  Meshworking intelligence creates a “meshwork” by weaving together the best of two operating systems — one that self-organizes, and one that replicates holarchical structures. The resulting meshwork creates and aligns complex responsive structures and systems that flex and flow.

Candidates for the Meshworkers of the Year Award invest dollars, time, effort and expertise at a level of complexity that serves a whole city or cities.

projects.title: The Society of the Thing - Kgotla, leadership through dialogue
projects.description: Facilitator in Kgotla process. The word Kgotla comes from Botswana and means meeting circle or assembly, led by a local chief. Kgotla techniques allow everyone to have their say, they help the leader come to a decision everyone accepts and supports, and they develop the skills to realise dreams. From major strategic changes of direction to practical solutions in daily operations – the techniques of a Kgotla can be used in many situations. What is your dream?

projects.title: Quality Centre, voorzitter en coach &U Vluchtelingmeidenproject
projects.description:
Het Quality Centre Vluchtelingvrouwen is een interculturele organisatie die met duurzame sociale netwerkvorming vluchtelingvrouwen faciliteert hun kwaliteiten te ontdekken, te ontwikkelen en te ontplooien in de samenleving.

Samen met een duo-partner vorm ik de zakelijke leiding van de organisatie. Naast algemene coördinatie ligt mijn accent op de financiële zaken als projectplannen schrijven met bijbehorende subsidieaanvragen indienen en beheren, aansturen van de boekhouder, etc. 
Daarnaast coördineer ik het &U Vluchtelingmeidenproject. Utrechtse vluchtelingmeiden van 12 t/m 18 jaar zijn een schooljaar lang gekoppeld aan een coach (jonge vrouw van 19-30 jaar), om door hun laagdrempelige contact hun zelfvertrouwen en zelfredzaamheid in de Nederlandse samenleving te bevorderen.

contributors.headline: Founder, Strategic Connector & social architect at The Hague Center for Global Governance, Innovation and Emergence

(Team)Coaching, Grondige pas op de plaats, Organisatie-ontwikkeling en Leiderschap
B2B Marketing at Volop Leads

projects.title: &U Vluchtelingmeidenproject
projects.description:
Jonge vluchtelingenvrouwen (12-18 jaar) moeten vaak manoeuvreren tussen normen en waarden van de Nederlandse samenleving en die vanuit hun eigen achtergrond. Dit kan leiden tot identiteitsproblemen en conflicten met ouders, familie en omgeving. Hierdoor kunnen op school en thuis problemen ontstaan. Ook kan het voor veel meiden lastig zijn hun vrije tijd in te delen op een manier die ook hun ouders accepteren. 
Wij koppelen coaches (25-35 jaar) aan deze meiden en bevorderen op deze manier de integratie, maatschappelijke participatie, zelfredzaamheid en het maken van eigen keuzes van de jonge vrouwen.

projects.title: Turquoise Research
projects.description: The Dutch Center for Human Emergence’s School of Synnervation have been researching into the qualities and expressions of what in Spiral Dynamics is known as the Turquoise / Holistic value system. The impulse for this came as we reached the limits of our existing coping mechanisms and had a sense that this is what was needed next – for us and others in the world. For this project we experimented with an Integral research framework and process, which the report also describes.

profile_positions.title: Co-producer, co-convenor, steward, presenter

profile_positions.description:
One Humanity Institute is a social incubator. A global nexus where one can experience both the micro and macro potential of a united humanity. The One Humanity Institute (OHI) is a global institute without walls represented with a Center located in Oświęcim, Poland, next to Auschwitz.

Acting as an intergenerational hub, OHI Bakery is the launching point and prototype for the larger campus. It will serve as a co-working space, global meeting hub, and peace library alongside a revitalized bakery. It will again serve the community, its local youth, and visitors from around the world. It will become  a living laboratory for solutions for peaceful co-existence for a more compassionate, equitable and just world.

profile_positions.description:
Foundation, The Hague Center (THC) catalyses and facilitates transformative social change processes to support the current human and planetary evolution from separation and polarization
towards coherence and unity. We co-­‐design processes using powerful social and spiritual technologies for collaboration and co-­‐creation that unite diverse stakeholders into an integrated community with resilient capacities.

Meshworks, Wheel of Co Creation, Spiral Dynamics Integral, U process, Art of Hosting, Dubble S Curve, ECOtherapy, ECOintention, Spiritual Intelligence SQ21

company.name: Integral City Meshworks Ltd & Integral City Netherlands

profile_positions.company: Integral City Meshworks Ltd & Integral City Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
"Out beyond the smart city, out beyond the resilient city,
Lives the Integral City. There is a Knowing Field ... we will meet you there."
 
Integral City Meshworkers think, act, relate and work for the healthy city of the future.
Integral City Meshworkers explore the city as a whole system like the human equivalent of the beehive. We use an integral meta-framework to reframe the city as a resilient, vibrant human habitat in dynamic balance with its eco-region.
http://www.integralcity.com
profile_positions.title: Member International Seed Team; Co initiator Integral City NL

profile_positions.description:
Our purpose is to empower the emergence of our conscious evolution.

After launching WholeWorld-View at London's House of Lords in July 2017, based on its message, the Unity Conference (attended by over 200 leaders of faiths, nations and organisations) in November 2018 has inspired an emerging Unity Community.

Now over 900 strong we are a fast-growing international community of change-makers co-creating together to Link Up and Lift Up - building enormous positive, energetic potential for hope in action as we celebrate and support our diversity in our unity.

The  scientifically-based WholeWorld-View naturally reconciles with universal spiritual experiences to co-create a breakthrough in the understanding of the nature of reality, the evolutionary moment we are living in, what it means to be human, and our influence on the evolution of life on our planet.

Inspired by the book, The Cosmic Hologram, a WholeWorld-View provides a foundation and practical perspectives towards problem solving upon which we can shift our individual, and collective, values and behaviours to be aligned, and in harmony, with the natural world and cosmic principles.

Our choices now will determine what the next stage of the evolution of Humanity on Earth will be.
profile_positions.title: Core team member & facilitator
Core team member - design & strategy; Lead Inter-generational network

company.name: Caravan of Unity Europe and beyond

profile_positions.company: Caravan of Unity Europe and beyond
profile_positions.description:
The Caravan of Unity is not a caravan in a classic sense. Originally used to describe a diverse group of people travelling together by camel or camper van, we define the term caravan in a new and contemporary way.

intention
What travels in our caravan is the energy of peace and the spirit of unity, finding expression through the actions and events of our Europe-wide and gobal network of members, friends and co-creators during the first three weeks of September 2020 and culminating in the global celebration of World Peace Day on September 21st.

organisations around the world
Co-Creating Europe, host of the Caravan of Unity’s European leg, is a growing network of individuals, initiatives and organisations from Europe and around the world. Together with our partners, Unity Earth, The Hague Center for Global Governance, One Humanity Institute and The Missing Kind, we envision this caravan to grow into one of the largest and most diverse physical and digital collective movements for peace in human history.

company.name: CHE Center for Human Emerngece Netherlands

volunteer_experiences.description:
Purpose CHE: integral societal innovation as sacred partnership in life
CHE serves societal innovation by connecting and vitalizing individuals, organizations and communities through integral experience, in The Netherlands, for the world.

https://onehumanity.institute/
One Humanity Institute, to be located in Auschwitz-Oswiecim, Poland, encompasses the vision of building a “City of Hope,” a destination where long or short-term visitors can experience the stark realities of the past alongside opportunities and models of transformation for a culture of sustainable peace and the uniting of humanity. Visiting One Humanity Institute will be a great reminder of a promise “Never Again”, so fully experienced at the Auschwitz Museum, to seeing themselves as part of the solutions needed for fostering a better world for all.
